author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

core_concepts.definition: Rare, high-impact events that are unpredictable and rationalized after the fact.
Systems that gain from disorder, volatility, and stress.
Decision-makers should share in the risks of their actions.
Improving systems by removing harmful elements instead of adding features.
Mistaking structured, rule-based randomness for real-world complexity.

learning_principles: Expect the unexpected â€” plan for resilience, not prediction.
Align incentives so decision-makers face the same risks as others.
